??_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

albisccp_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: time-means weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction - see <https://www.cfmip.org/tools-and-data/cosp>

albsrfc_tavg-u-hxy-sn.comment: surface albedo at grid cell level (i.e. the albedo averaged over all potential subgrid-scale structures) over all wave-bands; this shall apply to all realms (land, ocean, sea ice, land ice)

aod550volso4_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: This is the monthly averaged aerosol optical thickness at 550 nm due to stratospheric volcanic sulphate aerosols
aod550volso4_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Monthly Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm Due to Stratospheric Volcanic Aerosols

areacella_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: Cell areas for any grid used to report atmospheric variables and any other variable using that grid (e.g., soil moisture content). These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of global integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere).
areacella_ti-u-hxy-u.long_name: Grid-Cell Area for Atmospheric Grid Variables

bldepmax_tstat-u-hxy-u.comment: maximum boundary layer height during the day (add cell_methods attribute: "time: maximum")

bldepmin_tstat-u-hxy-u.comment: minimum boundary layer height during the day (add cell_methods attribute: "time: minimum")

ccb_tavg-u-hxy-ccl.cell_methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area)
ccb_tavg-u-hxy-ccl.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
ccb_tavg-u-hxy-ccl.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base

ccb_tpt-u-hxys-u.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
ccb_tpt-u-hxys-u.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base

ccldncl_tavg-u-hxy-ccl.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.
ccldncl_tavg-u-hxy-ccl.long_name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Convective Cloud Tops

cct_tavg-u-hxy-ccl.cell_methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area)
cct_tavg-u-hxy-ccl.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
cct_tavg-u-hxy-ccl.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top

cct_tpt-u-hxys-u.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
cct_tpt-u-hxys-u.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top

ci_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Fraction of time that convection occurs in the grid cell .
ci_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Fraction of Time Convection Occurs in Cell

ci_tpt-u-hxys-u.comment: Fraction of time that convection occurs in the grid cell .
ci_tpt-u-hxys-u.long_name: Fraction of Time Convection Occurs in Cell

cl_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: Percentage cloud cover, including both large-scale and convective cloud.

cl_tpt-l-hxys-u.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

clcalipso_tavg-220hPa-hxy-air.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 220hPa
clcalipso_tavg-220hPa-hxy-air.long_name: CALIPSO High Level Cloud Area Percentage

clcalipso_tavg-560hPa-hxy-air.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 560hPa
clcalipso_tavg-560hPa-hxy-air.long_name: CALIPSO Mid Level Cloud Cover Percentage

clcalipso_tavg-840hPa-hxy-air.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 840hPa
clcalipso_tavg-840hPa-hxy-air.long_name: CALIPSO Low Level Cloud Cover Percentage

clcalipso_tavg-h40-hxy-air.comment: Percentage cloud cover in CALIPSO standard atmospheric layers.

cldnci_tavg-u-hxy-cl.comment: Concentration 'as seen from space' over ice-cloud portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with ice cloud or, if available, it is the sum over all ice cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total ice cloud top fraction (as seen from TOA) of each time sample when computing monthly mean.
cldnci_tavg-u-hxy-cl.long_name: Ice Crystal Number Concentration of Cloud Tops

cldncl_tavg-u-hxy-cl.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.
cldncl_tavg-u-hxy-cl.long_name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Cloud Tops

cldnvi_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

cli_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: Calculated as the mass of cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

cli_tpt-l-hxys-u.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. This is the mass of  cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clic_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
clic_tavg-l-hxy-u.long_name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice

clic_tpt-l-hxy-u.comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
clic_tpt-l-hxy-u.long_name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice

clis_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
clis_tavg-l-hxy-u.long_name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice

clis_tpt-l-hxy-u.comment: Calculate as the mass of stratiform cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  Include precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
clis_tpt-l-hxy-u.long_name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice

clisccp_tavg-p7c-hxy-air.comment: Percentage cloud cover in optical depth categories.

clivi_tpt-u-hxy-u.comment: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clivi_tpt-u-hxys-u.comment: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clivic_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: calculate mass of convective ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clivimodis_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column) as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator.

clmisr_tavg-h16-hxy-air.long_name: Percentage Cloud Cover as Calculated by the MISR Simulator (Including Error Flag)

clmodis_tavg-p7c-hxy-air.comment: Percentage of total cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same used by the ISCCP instrument simulator. This is the equivalent MODIS version of the ISCCP _clisccp _variable.

clmodisiceReff_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage ice-cloud cover as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of cloud IWP (cloud ice water path) and r_eff (effective droplet size).
clmodisiceReff_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: MODIS Ice Topped Cloud Area Fraction

clmodisice_tavg-p7c-hxy-air.comment: Percentage ice-cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same as used by clisccp output from the ISCCP satellite simulator.
clmodisice_tavg-p7c-hxy-air.long_name: MODIS Ice Topped Cloud Area Fraction

clmodisliquidReff_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage liquid-cloud cover as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of LWP (cloud liquid water path) and r_eff (droplet effective radius).
clmodisliquidReff_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: MODIS Liquid Topped Cloud Area Fraction

clmodisliquid_tavg-p7c-hxy-air.comment: Percentage liquid-cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same used by clisccp (ISCCP simulator).
clmodisliquid_tavg-p7c-hxy-air.long_name: MODIS Liquid Topped Cloud Area Fraction

cls_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: Cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column due to stratiform clouds, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

clt_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

clt_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

clt_tpt-u-hxy-u.comment: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.

clt_tpt-u-hxys-u.comment: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.

cltcalipso_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the  Cloud-Aerosol Lidar and Infrared Pathfinder Satellite Observation (CALIPSO) instrument. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

cltisccp_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the International Satellite Cloud Climatology Project (ISCCP) analysis. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  (MODIS). Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

clw_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: Calculated as the mass of  cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
clw_tavg-l-hxy-u.long_name: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water

clw_tpt-l-hxys-u.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  This is the mass of  cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
clw_tpt-l-hxys-u.long_name: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water

clwc_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
clwc_tavg-l-hxy-u.long_name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water

clwc_tpt-l-hxy-u.comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
clwc_tpt-l-hxy-u.long_name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water

clws_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
clws_tavg-l-hxy-u.long_name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water

clws_tpt-l-hxy-u.comment: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
clws_tpt-l-hxy-u.long_name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water

clwvi_tpt-u-hxy-u.comment: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clwvi_tpt-u-hxys-u.comment: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clwvic_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: calculate mass of convective condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clwvimodis_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column) as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator.

co2_tavg-p19-hxy-air.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

co2_tavg-u-hm-u.comment: As co2, but only at the surface

co2_tclm-p19-hxy-air.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years
co2_tclm-p19-hxy-air.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

co2_tclm-u-hm-u.cell_methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean within years time: mean over years
co2_tclm-u-hm-u.comment: Total atmospheric mass of Carbon Dioxide

co2mass_tavg-u-hm-u.cell_methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean
co2mass_tavg-u-hm-u.comment: Total atmospheric mass of Carbon Dioxide

dmc_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: The net mass flux  represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.   This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

dtauc_tpt-l-hxy-ccl.comment: This is the in-cloud optical depth obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell

dtaus_tpt-l-hxy-ccl.comment: This is the in-cloud optical depth obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell.

edt_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: Vertical diffusion coefficient for temperature due to parametrised eddies

edt_tpt-l-hxys-u.comment: Vertical diffusion coefficient for temperature due to parametrised eddies

epfy_tavg-p39-hy-air.comment: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics Meridional component Fy of Eliassen-Palm (EP) flux (Fy, Fz) derived from 6hr or higher frequency fields (use daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr are not available). Please use the definitions given by equation 3.5.3a of Andrews, Holton and Leovy text book, but scaled by density to have units m3 s-2.
epfy_tavg-p39-hy-air.long_name: Northward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux

epfz_tavg-p39-hy-air.long_name: Upward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux

evspsbl_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: at surface; flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

evspsbl_tpt-u-hxys-u.comment: at surface; flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

evu_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: Vertical diffusion coefficient for momentum due to parametrised eddies

evu_tpt-l-hxys-u.comment: Vertical diffusion coefficient for momentum due to parametrised eddies

fco2antt_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.
fco2antt_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fco2antt_tpt-u-hxys-u.comment: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.
fco2antt_tpt-u-hxys-u.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fco2fos_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)
fco2fos_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fco2fos_tpt-u-hxys-u.comment: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)
fco2fos_tpt-u-hxys-u.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fco2nat_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L_mon and O_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., "net ecosystem biospheric productivity", for land, and "air to sea CO2 flux", for ocean.)
fco2nat_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]

fco2nat_tpt-u-hxys-u.comment: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L_mon and O_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., "net ecosystem biospheric productivity", for land, and "air to sea CO2 flux", for ocean.)
fco2nat_tpt-u-hxys-u.long_name: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]

hfdsnb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
hfdsnb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Downward heat flux at snow botton
hfdsnb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Snow Base

hfls_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Hourly surface upward latent heat flux

hfss_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Hourly surface upward sensible heat flux

hfss_tpt-u-hxys-u.comment: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

hur_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hur_tavg-p19-hxy-air.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hur_tavg-p19-hxy-u.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hur_tpt-500hPa-hxy-air.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: point
hur_tpt-500hPa-hxy-air.comment: Relative humidity at 500 hPa, 6 hourly instantaneous

hur_tpt-850hPa-hxy-air.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: point

hur_tpt-l-hxys-u.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hurs_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.comment: Relative humidity at 2m above the surface
hurs_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.long_name: Hourly relative humidity at the surface

hurs_tpt-h2m-hxy-u.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hurs_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hursmax_tstat-h2m-hxy-u.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hursmin_tstat-h2m-hxy-crp.cell_methods: area: mean where crops time: minimum within days time: mean over days
hursmin_tstat-h2m-hxy-crp.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
hursmin_tstat-h2m-hxy-crp.long_name: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Relative Humidity over Crop Tile

hursmin_tstat-h2m-hxy-u.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hus_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

hus_tavg-p19-hxy-u.comment: These are standard variables from CMIP5.

hus_tpt-l-hxys-u.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

hus_tpt-p7h-hxy-air.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: point

hus_tpt-u-hxy-air.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: point
hus_tpt-u-hxy-air.comment: Specific humidity on 6 pressure levels in the lower troposphere

intuadse_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Vertically integrated eastward dry static energy transport (cp.T +zg).v (Mass_weighted_vertical integral of the product of eastward wind by dry static_energy per mass unit)
intuadse_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Vertically Integrated Eastward Dry Static Energy Transport

intuaw_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Vertically integrated Eastward moisture transport (Mass weighted vertical integral of the product of eastward wind by total water mass per unit mass)

intuaw_tpt-u-hxy-u.comment: Vertically integrated eastward moisture transport (Mass weighted vertical integral of the product of eastward wind by total water mass per unit mass)
intuaw_tpt-u-hxy-u.long_name: 6 hourly instantaneous vertical integral of zonal water vapor flux

intvadse_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Vertically integrated northward dry static energy transport (cp.T +zg).v (Mass_weighted_vertical integral of the product of northward wind by dry static_energy per mass unit)
intvadse_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Vertically Integrated Northward Dry Static Energy Transport

intvaw_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Vertically integrated Northward moisture transport (Mass_weighted_vertical integral of the product of northward wind by total water mass per unit mass)

intvaw_tpt-u-hxy-u.comment: Vertically integrated northward moisture transport (Mass_weighted_vertical integral of the product of northward wind by total water mass per unit mass)
intvaw_tpt-u-hxy-u.long_name: 6 hourly instantaneous integral of meridional moisture flux

jpdftaureicemodis_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint distribution, ice
jpdftaureicemodis_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: MODIS Joint Distribution of Optical Thickness and Particle Size, Ice

jpdftaureliqmodis_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint distribution, liquid
jpdftaureliqmodis_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid

lat_ti-u-hxys-u.comment: Latitude is positive northward; its units of degree_north (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid_latitude should be used instead of latitude. Grid latitude is positive in the grid-northward direction, but its units should be plain degree.

loadbc_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: The total dry mass of black carbon aerosol particles per unit area.

loaddust_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: The total dry mass of dust aerosol particles per unit area.

loadnh4_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: The total dry mass of ammonium aerosol particles per unit area.

loadno3_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: The total dry mass of nitrate aerosol particles per unit area.

loadoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: atmosphere dry organic content: This is the vertically integrated sum of atmosphere_primary_organic_content and atmosphere_secondary_organic_content (see next two table entries).
loadoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Load of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter

loadpoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: The total dry mass of primary particulate organic aerosol particles per unit area.

lon_ti-u-hxys-u.comment: Longitude is positive eastward; its units of degree_east (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid_longitude should be used instead of longitude. Grid longitude is positive in the grid-eastward direction, but its units should be plain degree.

mc_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

mc_tpt-l-hxys-u.comment: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the updrafts).

mcd_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

mcu_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

noaahi_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.comment:
mean 2m daily NOAA heat index.
The perceived air temperature when relative humidity is taken into consideration (which makes it feel hotter than the actual air temperature).
The heat index is only defined when the ambient air temperature is at or above 299.817 K.
NOAA heat index = -42.379 + 2.04901523(T) + 10.14333127(R) - 0.22475541(T)(R) - 6.83783e-3 sqr(T) - 5.481717e-2 sqr(R) + 1.22874e-3 sqr(T) (R) + 8.5282e-4 (T) sqr(R) - 1.99e-6 sqr(T) sqr(R)
where T is 2 m temperature (degrees F), R is relative humidity (%)

noaahimax_tstat-h2m-hxy-u.comment:
max 2m daily NOAA heat index 
The perceived air temperature when relative humidity is taken into consideration (which makes it feel hotter than the actual air temperature).
The heat index is only defined when the ambient air temperature is at or above 299.817 K.
NOAA heat index = -42.379 + 2.04901523(T) + 10.14333127(R) - 0.22475541(T)(R) - 6.83783e-3 sqr(T) - 5.481717e-2 sqr(R) + 1.22874e-3 sqr(T) (R) + 8.5282e-4 (T) sqr(R) - 1.99e-6 sqr(T) sqr(R)
where T is 2 m temperature (degrees F), R is relative humidity (%)

reffcclwtop_tavg-u-hxy-ccl.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius "as seen from space" over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.daily data, separated to large-scale clouds, convective clouds. If any of the cloud is from more than one process (i.e. shallow convection), please provide them separately.

rlds_tpt-u-hxy-u.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

tawb_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.comment:
mean 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature (WBGT). 
Wet Bulb Globe Temperature (WBGT) is a particularly effective indicator of heat stress for active populations such as outdoor workers and athletes.
The calculation should be done with: 
WBGT = 0.567 \* T_C + 0.393 \* e/100 + 3.94, where T_C is temperature in degrees C, and e = huss \* p \* M_air / M_H2O, where "huss=specific humidity in kg/kg", M_H2O = 18.01528/1000 # kg/mol, M_air = 28.964/1000 # kg/mol for dry air and "P = surface pressure in Pa"
tawb_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.long_name: mean 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature

tawbmax_tstat-h2m-hxy-u.comment:
max 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature (WGBT): 
Wet Bulb Globe Temperature (WBGT) is a particularly effective indicator of heat stress for active populations such as outdoor workers and athletes.
The calculation should be done with: 
WBGT = 0.567 \* T_C + 0.393 \* e/100 + 3.94, where T_C is temperature in degrees C, and e = huss \* p \* M_air / M_H2O, where "huss=specific humidity in kg/kg", M_H2O = 18.01528/1000 # kg/mol, M_air = 28.964/1000 # kg/mol for dry air and "P = surface pressure in Pa"
tawbmax_tstat-h2m-hxy-u.long_name: maximum 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature

tnhusd_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.

For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.

tnhusscp_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: The phrase "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. "Specific" means per unit mass. Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due_to_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name of tendency_of_specific_humidity_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain the effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation to or from water vapor. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).

tnhusscpbl_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: To be specified only in  models which do not separate budget terms for stratiform cloud, precipitation and boundary layer schemes.  Includes all bounday layer terms including and diffusive terms.
tnhusscpbl_tavg-l-hxy-u.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing

zg_tavg-l-hxy-u.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
